metadata.titel_preek: Mrs. Hamer, Mrs. Durr, Brother Will, and the Word of Faith

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God establishes His own righteousness through the death of Christ for the ungodly, bypassing human attempts to establish righteousness through law or merit.

tekstueel_bewijs: God raised him from the dead
Christ is the end of the law
God puts his words on the lips of human beings
the righteousness that comes from God
every one who has faith may be justified
the righteousness that comes from God
the word of faith which we preach

ontvanger.identificatie: The Ungodly / The Unspiritual / The Hearer
tekstueel_bewijs: bestows his riches upon all who call upon him
reclaim this whole human race of miserable offenders
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver (the ungodly beneficiary).

tekstueel_bewijs: how are they to hear without a preacher?
the word of faith which we preach
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; Christ is the Mediator/Helper in the act of justification.
helper.rol_van_geest: Indwelling power implied through the 'word in your heart'.

tekstueel_bewijs: unaided human nature always wants to divide
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad behavior but the ontological pride of 'establishing one's own righteousness,' which blocks submission to God.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical life of the believer (civil rights, social action) as a consequence of the breakdown of distinctions.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Saved Believer (e.g., Fannie Lou Hamer)
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Love and struggle for the neighbor
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The preacher insists that social action (Program 2) must arise out of the radical breakdown of distinctions achieved by Christ (Program 1).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God raised him from the dead
the same Lord is Lord of all and bestows his riches
Christ is the end of the law
voorbeelden_mens_subject: if you confess with your lips
we were in love with our own righteousness

voorbeelden: we have to be prepared to defend our position
human nature always wants to divide
being ignorant of the righteousness that comes from God
no power in heaven or earth that can wrest

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' (Pouvoir) of God's grace to overcome human inability and sin.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the failure of S1-negation (Self-righteousness) to the reality of S2 (Ungodliness), finally resolving in S1 (Grace) through Christ.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ is the 'end of the law,' meaning he terminates the cycle of self-justification.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; ungodliness is described as 'human muck' and 'atrocity'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon explicitly attacks moralism and centers God's action for the 'ungodly' as the only source of power.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Figures like Fannie Lou Hamer are used as 'theologians' of grace rather than mere moral examples to imitate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Fannie Lou Hamer is a witness to what God's grace does, not a hero of her own making.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and humility; removal of the burden of self-justification.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation where God is the sole actor in justification.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Perfect integration of the primary (soteriological) and secondary (ethical) programs.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'unconditional grace' and the need for church discipline.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Christ died for the ungodly... not weighing our merits, but pardoning our offenses.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Word itself acts as the endowment of power.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is seen as an 'inherent sinfulness' that requires a 'scandalous' grace.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative program.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly low on Devoir (obligation), which is intentional to combat legalism.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in grace-oriented homiletics that uses the actantial structure to dismantle moralism.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the use of the three books as illustrations, the Greimas analysis reveals how these stories function as actants to prove the 'Pouvoir' of grace.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the Greek of Romans 10; this analysis shows how the 'engine' of the sermon mirrors Paul's own actantial shift from Law to Christ.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Opponent' in this sermon is not the 'sinner' but the 'righteous person' trying to save themselves.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a direct application of Fleming Rutledge's own homiletical theory.
